CatDescriptText: Mr. Paul Clark, salesman, Greentree, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 24, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "What do you think is the major cause (or causes) of the increase in juvenile delinquency?" answer reads: "I think the major cause is probably because there is not enough parental supervision. The kids have too much freedom and there's not enough of the old-fashioned discipline."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Paul Clark wearing plaid suit jacket and patterned necktie, standing in front of C.C. Mellor's, Smithfield Street, Downtown
